shows.title: Black Men in Uniform
shows.plot_overview: Pata Seca  (1828), a man whose back bore the whip marks of his enslavers , whose eyes held the haunted memory of being forced to breed over 200 slave children in order to sustain his master’s plantation.  Men broken but unbowed, transformed from field hands into soldiers from the civil war to Vietnam.  This documentary weaves together authentic narratives from the 1800s, accompanied by original images and footage, highlighting the significant influence that Black men in uniform had in Hollywood
